dublin_core.dcvalue: This article introduces the special section on experience sampling methods and ecological momentary assessment in clinical assessment We review the conceptual basis for experience sampling methods ESM Csikszentmihalyi And Larson 1987 and ecological momentary assessment EMA Stone And Shiffman 1994 Next we highlight several advantageous features of ESM EMA as applied to psychological assessment and clinical research We provide a brief overview of the articles in this special section each of which focuses on 1 of the following major classes of psychological disorders mood disorders and mood dysregulation Ebner Priemer And Trull 2009 anxiety disorders Alpers 2009 substance use disorders Shiffman 2009 and psychosis Oorschot Kwapil Delespaul And Myin Germeys 2009 Finally we discuss prospects future challenges and limitations of ESM EMA
Using experience sampling methods/ecological momentary assessment (ESM/EMA) in clinical assessment and clinical research: introduction to the special section.
